steps.title: Build Paragraphs
steps.completionCriteria: Complete all 4 paragraphs (10+ words per blank)

content.instructions: Fill in each blank to build your essay paragraph by paragraph. Aim for 10-15 words per blank.

paragraphs.name: Introduction
paragraphs.template: While some _____ [state the first view about family care], others _____ [state the opposite view about nursing homes]. In my opinion, _____ [clearly state YOUR position].

blanks.label: First view about family care
blanks.hint: Start with 'believe that elderly parents' or 'argue that aging parents'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., believe that elderly parents should live with their adult children for emotional support

blanks.label: Opposite view about nursing homes
blanks.hint: Use 'argue that' or 'contend that' followed by nursing home benefits
blanks.placeholder: e.g., contend that nursing homes provide better professional care and medical facilities

blanks.label: Your position
blanks.hint: Be clear! Take a position or say 'it depends on...'
blanks.placeholder: e.g., the best choice depends on the elderly person's health condition and family circumstances

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 1
paragraphs.template: On the one hand, _____ [topic sentence about family care advantages]. This is because _____ [explain the reason]. For instance, _____ [give a specific example]. As a result, _____ [state the consequence or benefit].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - family care advantages
blanks.hint: Main benefit of living with family in one sentence
blanks.placeholder: e.g., living with adult children provides elderly parents with emotional comfort and daily companionship

blanks.label: Explain the reason
blanks.hint: WHY does family care provide this benefit?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., family members can provide love, attention and a sense of belonging that strangers cannot offer

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.placeholder: e.g., grandparents can interact daily with grandchildren, sharing stories and creating meaningful family memories

blanks.label: Consequence/benefit
blanks.hint: What is the final outcome of this benefit?
blanks.placeholder: e.g., this emotional support often leads to better mental health and increased life satisfaction for the elderly

paragraphs.name: Body Paragraph 2
paragraphs.template: On the other hand, _____ [topic sentence about nursing home advantages]. The main reason is _____ [explain why]. For example, _____ [specific example]. Therefore, _____ [conclusion about this perspective].

blanks.label: Topic sentence - nursing home advantages
blanks.placeholder: e.g., nursing homes offer professional medical care and specialized facilities that families cannot provide

blanks.label: Explain why
blanks.hint: Explain the mechanism or reasoning behind this benefit
blanks.placeholder: e.g., trained nurses can monitor health conditions continuously and respond immediately to medical emergencies

blanks.label: Specific example
blanks.hint: Concrete example showing nursing home benefits
blanks.placeholder: e.g., elderly with conditions like dementia or mobility issues receive specialized care and proper medical equipment

blanks.label: Conclusion about this view
blanks.placeholder: e.g., these advantages make nursing homes particularly suitable for elderly with serious health conditions

paragraphs.name: Conclusion
paragraphs.template: In conclusion, while _____ [briefly summarize both views], I believe _____ [restate your opinion with a final thought].

blanks.label: Summarize both views
blanks.hint: One sentence mentioning both family care and nursing home advantages
blanks.placeholder: e.g., both family care and nursing homes offer distinct benefits in terms of emotional support and professional care

blanks.label: Restate opinion + final thought
blanks.hint: Clearly restate YOUR position and add a final insight
blanks.placeholder: e.g., the optimal choice depends on the elderly person's specific health needs and the family's ability to provide adequate care

modelEssay.text:
The question of where elderly parents should spend their later years has become increasingly important in aging societies. While some believe that the elderly should live with their adult children, others argue that nursing homes provide better care. In my opinion, the ideal arrangement depends on the specific health needs and family circumstances of each individual.

On the one hand, living with adult children offers significant emotional and social benefits. Family environments provide daily companionship, love, and a sense of belonging that institutional settings often lack. For instance, elderly parents living with their families can interact with grandchildren regularly, which brings joy and purpose to their lives while strengthening intergenerational bonds. Furthermore, familiar surroundings and family routines can reduce anxiety and depression commonly experienced by seniors. As a result, many elderly individuals report higher life satisfaction when living with loved ones.

On the other hand, nursing homes offer professional medical care that families may be unable to provide. These facilities employ trained healthcare professionals who can monitor health conditions continuously and respond to emergencies immediately. For example, elderly individuals suffering from dementia, mobility issues, or chronic illnesses often require specialized equipment and round-the-clock supervision that most families cannot offer. Moreover, nursing homes provide social activities and peer interaction with other residents, which can combat loneliness.

In conclusion, while both living arrangements have distinct advantages, I believe the optimal choice depends on the elderly person's health condition and the family's capacity to provide adequate care. For those with serious medical needs, nursing homes may be more appropriate, while healthier seniors might thrive better in family environments.
